If two people or ideas are diametrical opposites, they are as different as possible: diametrical opposite This is the diametrical opposite of what most people would say.diametrical opposition The proposed changes are in almost diametrical opposition to those we asked for. Related word
diametricallySynonym
diametric
relating to the diameter of something (= a straight line that goes from one side of a round shape or object, through the centre point, to the opposite edge): The Petri dishes had diametrical lines drawn on the bottom to identify the centre of the plate. The growth of the fungus was recorded as the mean of measurements along two diametrical axes. Related word
diameter
More examplesFewer examplesThis approach set itself in diametrical opposition to the common approach in finance and economics at the time.Despite diametrical career choices, the two friends respect and appreciate each other. Divide the circle using two diametrical lines; one representing the north and south, the other the east and west.
